Articles.Content:
Jeez I'm sorry. It won't happen again. I super-promise. But please just say so if it is an issue by replying below, I will take care of it immediately. Until then, a series of stars is not a bad word, but just a fancy line break. Also, Aqua teen hunger force got canceled, so have remorse.

Edited August 24, 2015 by AlextheBodacious
I'll be better.

KSP has pretty much had its final content update already. The new updates are pretty much only performance updates and console ports. Plus, if squad ever goes bankrupt, the game cannot go down because it does not require a Internet connection to play, and it will probably stay on steam.

It will probably will still be seeded by pirates. A true test for the longevity of a game is how long it will remain seeded on various torrent, even long after it has been taken off mainstream circulation.

Also, you need some sleep. It helps, at least in my case dealing with depression and have weird thoughts banging the doors of my mind. Turn off the dial of consciousness can give you some silence, even if it is just for a little while.

I know. But what will it be? who knows, 2.6? 7.3? no way of knowing.

- - - Updated - - -

Rain: thanks. you're a good guy.

You say you had an existential crisis over KSP. An existential crisis is where one asks questions about the foundations of their life and whether their life has any meaning, value, and so forth. This means that, at least partly, KSP is a thing your life is built on. KSP shouldn't be a foundation of your life. Get outside, go out and run around in nature, and if you're one of the unlucky many who live in the city and can't access nature in all her glory without a few-hour ride in an auto, at least go to whatever parks you have available to you. If you're more of an inside guy (Or conditions are unfavourable) write, read, paint, do something with much more value and something that's actually worth your time. Find something to do that your heart and soul burns for and is attracted to like a magnet to iron. Do something that will bring much more satisfaction to your life and build you up rather than play a stupid little game about sending stupid little green men to imaginary celestial bodies.

And bud, get some sleep and eat right. It looks like you're feeling depressed like I was for a long time and those two things helped me a lot. Get out in nature and experience her with all your senses, pay attention to all of them and think about what words you'd use to describe the sensations. If you get suicidal thoughts talk to family, friends, school administration, and even medical professionals, they'll get you taken care of.

Edited August 22, 2015 by Flymetothemun
Some day the sun will swell into a red giant and incinerate the earth, too, but there's no need to panic just yet.

fly: that's... a bit intense. I did say I was on what is now a 45-day vacation... um... thanks?

Wait, suicidal? Ouch. Are you sure you didn't just google Existential & are trying to hard to help? Not to make any assumptions, but still...

Vana: you get it.

fly: that's... a bit intense. I did say I was on what is now a 45-day vacation... um... thanks?

Wait, suicidal? Ouch. Are you sure you didn't just google Existential & are trying to hard to help? Not to make any assumptions, but still...

Oh, sorry if i was a bit intense. if I sense even a little bit of sadness I treat it incredibly seriously. I'm also a passionate writer, so that might've added to the air of seriousness.
